text: AppKit and UIKit give birth to something new and cross-platform
full-pick-text: AppKit and UIKit give birth to something new and cross-platform

text: Apple introduces a Copilot-like feature for Xcode powered by AI/ML
full-pick-text: Apple introduces a Copilot-like feature for Xcode powered by AI/ML
notes: • Not graded: "A feature in Xcode that uses AI/ML to suggest how to improve your code or solve common problems. It will most likely live in a sidebar and will probably be a Beta feature."

text: Apple introduces a proper Reminders API for developers
full-pick-text: Apple introduces a proper Reminders API for developers

text: Apple makes changes to the rules on in-app purchases, removing restrictions on linking to external websites for account creation, etc.
full-pick-text: Apple makes changes to the rules on in-app purchases, removing restrictions on linking to external websites for account creation, etc.
notes: • This came later in the year as a result of an antitrust settlement with Japan.

text: Apple releases a Safari API to deal with cookie consent forms
full-pick-text: Apple releases a Safari API to deal with cookie consent forms

text: Apple releases a weather API
full-pick-text: Apple releases a weather API
notes: • The revamped weather API was announced at WWDC in 2022.

text: Apple releases new developer APIs for Stage Manager
full-pick-text: Apple releases new developer APIs for Stage Manager
notes: • At the time of picking there were not any developer APIs for Stage Manager on either macOS or iPadOS, so anything will be "new".

text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October
full-pick-text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October

text: AR-specific features are added to Swift or SwiftUI
full-pick-text: AR-specific features are added to Swift or SwiftUI
notes: • Nothing in the keynote, but ARKit 6 is adding RoomPlan, a new Swift API for scanning a room with a camera and LiDAR scanner.

text: Big improvements to SwiftUI
full-pick-text: Big improvements to SwiftUI

text: Developers will get tools for more control over refresh rate/frame rate in apps
full-pick-text: Developers will get tools for more control over refresh rate/frame rate in apps
notes: • Myke got points for a similar prediction the next year.

text: DriverKit comes to iPadOS to let more kinds of accessories be supported on iPad
full-pick-text: DriverKit comes to iPadOS to let more kinds of accessories be supported on iPad

text: iPadOS is updated to include a more desktop-like mode with resizable and overlapping windows
full-pick-text: iPadOS is updated to include a more desktop-like mode with resizable and overlapping windows
notes: • Was originally a Risky pick with the addition of a "with keyboard and trackpad" clause, but some WebKit source code changes made it much less risky. He watered it down further by removing an "overlapping" clause as well and not phrasing it as a "desktop-like mode", but then decided to just go all the way back to the original pick.

text: New Notes framework for developers
full-pick-text: New Notes framework for developers

text: Shortcuts 2.0 is showed off at WWDC with a new developer framework for apps
full-pick-text: Shortcuts 2.0 is showed off at WWDC with a new developer framework for apps
notes: • "Shortcuts also gets folders and AirPlay actions in 2019."

text: Shortcuts gets an API on iOS and iPadOS for apps to run Shortcuts directly, without URL schemes
full-pick-text: Shortcuts gets an API on iOS and iPadOS for apps to run Shortcuts directly, without URL schemes

text: The iPad gets a new development tool to write code, on device, that is not Swift Playgrounds
full-pick-text: The iPad gets a new development tool to write code, on device, that is not Swift Playgrounds

text: The iPadOS cursor appears to be repurposed for using iPad apps in VR
full-pick-text: The iPadOS cursor appears to be repurposed for using iPad apps in VR
notes: • It wasn't obvious from the keynote, but later session information showed that when connected to a trackpad, visionOS indeed uses an almost exact clone of the iPad cursor.

text: The next version of iPadOS will introduce a brand new audio routing system, with support for selecting different input sources, similar to macOS...
full-pick-text: The next version of iPadOS will introduce a brand new audio routing system, with support for selecting different input sources, similar to macOS. This feature will finally allow podcasters like me to record local audio while also being on a FaceTime or Zoom call (assuming apps add support for it).
notes:
• "... This feature will finally allow podcasters like me to record local audio while also being on a FaceTime or Zoom call (assuming apps add support for it)."
  • And there's even more that isn't graded: "Devices that do not require drivers will work out of the box, like in macOS. I think the Sounds page of Settings will be redesigned."
  • Federico guesses that this is his longest-ever Risky Pick, and he's right, this is in fact his longest ever pick period, beating out this one from earlier the same year.

text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
full-pick-text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
notes: • Edited to clarify "third party" as a few Apple widgets are already interactive.

text: Tools for developers to make smoother or faster animations in iOS
full-pick-text: Tools for developers to make smoother or faster animations in iOS

text: WidgetKit gains new interactivity features that allow you to perform actions inside widgets without launching the associated app
full-pick-text: WidgetKit gains new interactivity features that allow you to perform actions inside widgets without launching the associated app

text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
full-pick-text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
notes: • The boolean operator "and" ends up taking this pick down.
